Module sims.custpoint
Package sims.custpoint.controller

Class MainMenuController

java.lang.Object
sims.custpoint.controller.MainMenuController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainMenuController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
A class responsible for handling logic within the Main Menu screen. Consists of generating displays for customers and inventory, adding, updating, and deleted said customers and appointments, checking for pending appointments, and report selection.

  • Method Details

    • selectDateRange

      private void selectDateRange()
      LAMBDA: The filtering by month and week provided a chance to much more easily create a date checking system. The month allowed for a simple (though slightly long) one liner to filter out unnecessary items, where the week allowed for a statement within the lambda to filter out unnecessary items. A method that handles the radio buttons allowing users to pick if they view all appointments, the appointments this week, or the appointments this month. Instead of using more DB calls, this will simply filter out what is shown based on a Java stream. The month filter selects for the current calendar month and the week filter selects the current day and stops at the end of the week thereafter (i.e. Mon-Sun, Wed-Tues).

    • onClickSearchCustomersFieldButton

      public void onClickSearchCustomersFieldButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Search for a customer by passing either its unique ID or the customer name. All items starting with the string or matching the exact ID will be displayed.
      Parameters:
      e - Event calling the method, either clicking the "Search" button or pressing the enter key in the search field.

    • onClickSearchAppointmentsFieldButton

      public void onClickSearchAppointmentsFieldButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Search for an appointment by passing either its unique ID or the title. All items starting with the string or matching the exact ID will be displayed.
      Parameters:
      e - Event calling the method, either clicking the "Search" button or pressing the enter key in the search field.

    • onClickExitButton

      private void onClickExitButton()
      LAMBDA FUNCTION: the ifPresent() method on the Alert class takes a function as an argument, allowing for a lambda expression to be passed in. This can avoid an extra, unnecessary layer of functional decomposition by creating an anonymous function to be run on its value. Allows a user to shut down the CustPoint management system.

    • clearAndSetTable

      private void clearAndSetTable(String tableName)
      Resets the provided tableName to the current information in the database. Used when items are edited without leaving the Main Menu view.
      Parameters:
      tableName - A String name of the table to be reset to the current DB state.

    • displayPendingAppointment

      private void displayPendingAppointment(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> appointments)
      LAMBDA: A cleaner approach to the normal for loop was presented by the anyMatch method. This allowed me to create a stream and iterate through the list until a match is found (or not) and alter the display accordingly. The simple .stream().anyMatch() previously would have required more code than those two methods.

      Iterates through a provided ObservableList of appointments and determines if any are within the next fifteen minutes. If so, relevant appointment information will be displayed on the screen. And if not, the user will be aware there are no pending appointments.

      Parameters:
      appointments - The appointments that will be searched through in order to identify a matching item (or not).

    • onClickAddCustomerButton

      private void onClickAddCustomerButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      On clicking the add button, move to the Customer screen with the adding functionality enabled.
      Parameters:
      e - The button press event on the Add button under the Customers table.

    • onClickModifyCustomerButton

      private void onClickModifyCustomerButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      On clicking the modify button, move to the Customer screen with the modify functionality enabled. The method also passes the Customer entry to modify.
      Parameters:
      e - The button press event on the Modify button under the Customers table.

    • onClickDeleteCustomerButton

      private void onClickDeleteCustomerButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Deletes the selected customer from the database after confirmation. It also clears all appointments tied to the customer.
      Parameters:
      e - The button press event on the Delete button under the Customers table.

    • onClickAddAppointmentButton

      private void onClickAddAppointmentButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      On clicking the add button, move to the Appointment screen with the adding functionality enabled.
      Parameters:
      e - The button press event on the Add button under the Appointments table.

    • onClickModifyAppointmentButton

      private void onClickModifyAppointmentButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      On clicking the modify button, move to the Appointment screen with the modify functionality enabled. The method also passes the Appointment entry to modify.
      Parameters:
      e - The button press event on the Modify button under the Appointments table.

      Parameters:
      e - The button press event on the Delete button under the Appointments table.

    • onClickViewReportsButton

      Specified by:
